title: Is a grocery delivery service profitable? - Quora

response.answer_text: I can only comment on the UK market; home delivery is very big, but causes huge losses Supermarkets 'losing £300m a year' from online grocery It is strange to think when I go to the “trouble” and expense of shopping in store, I will subsidise someone shopping from home. BUT this is just one perspective; the Toronto market will be differentmy reference is for nationwide operations operating at scale; it may be that 99% of Torontonians will not pay you to deliver groceries at C$10 a delivery. BUT 1%WILL, AND YOU CAN MAKE MONEY FROM THATSome might recognise this as “turnover is vanity, profit is sanity”is it regular groceries, to regular homes, with regular delivery, or are there some high value niches?for example, deliver healthy, homemade soups to offices, where office workers have made a new year’s resolution to eat healthily, might be a profitable niche or specialism you can exploit right nowor for elderly people who don't want to go out in the cold, and want you to collect prescription medicines at the same timeor for “wealthy” but tired and busy (new?) mothersGood luck in your endeavours.

Yes, grocery delivery service is profitable. We are living in a world of fast paced life and people don’t like to shop for things like groceries or daily food items instead they prefer to get them delivered at their doorstep. And specially in this pandemic situation, grocery delivery services are in high demand and availability is all that matters. There are more reasons for profitable grocery delivery services such as solution must have attractive and convenient features, better quality of product and better services etc. Hope this answer helps!
